Extract Segment Edge Matrix

Source: R/analytical_functions.R
segment.edges.Rd

Creates an adjacency matrix representing edges between segments based on mobility flows. This function is used for network visualization and analysis.

segment.edges(
  segments,
  cut.off = 1,
  mode = "directed",
  level = NULL,
  segment.reduction = NULL,
  method = "all",
  top = 3,
  diagonal = NULL,
  small.cell.reduction = 0
)

Arguments

segments

A moneca object returned by moneca.

cut.off

Numeric threshold for minimum relative risk to include an edge. Default is 1.

mode

Character string specifying the graph mode ("directed" or "undirected"). Default is "directed".

level

Integer vector specifying which hierarchical levels to include. Default includes all levels.

segment.reduction

Integer vector specifying levels for which to remove internal segment edges. Default includes all levels.

method

Character string specifying edge filtering method:

  • "all" (default): Include all edges above threshold

  • "top.out": Keep only the top outgoing edges per node

  • "top.in": Keep only the top incoming edges per node

top

Integer specifying how many top edges to keep when using "top.out" or "top.in" methods. Default is 3.

diagonal

Controls diagonal values. If NULL (default), diagonal is zeroed.

small.cell.reduction

Numeric threshold for small cell handling.

Value

A square matrix representing edge weights between nodes/segments.

See also

plot_moneca_ggraph, moneca.plot
